pull_request.title: [FC] Launch maestro tests with settings via deeplink
pull_request.body:
# Summary
- adds `stripeconnectionsexample://playground` deeplink to launch playground
- reads settings from query
- launches deeplinks with settings in maestro, and removes manual settings setup.

# Motivation
Shorten test execution

# Testing
<!-- How was the code tested? Be as specific as possible. -->
- [ ] Added tests
- [ ] Modified tests
- [ X] Manually verified

# Screenshots
| Before  | After |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| *before screenshot*  | *after screenshot* |

# Summary

commits.message:
[FC - Playground] Adds Playground Settings and moves existing settings (#7448)

* Adds settings.

* Adds flow to settings.

* Moves missing settings to new object.

* Adds payment intent request.

* Updates payments.

* Makes settings a data class.

* references settings.

* Types requests.

* Adds shared prefs read - write.

* Adds api value strings.

* Restores sub-definitions.

* Uses method reference

* Merges interfaces.

* Removes field.

* Renames snapshot.

* Removes Gson.

* Updates defaults / shared prefs.

* Updates e2e tests.

* Ktlint fixes.

* Updates title.

* Adds test tags.

* Reverts.

pull_request.title: [FC - Playground] Adds Playground Settings and moves existing settings
pull_request.body:
# Summary
- Adds `PlaygroundSettings` (map of settings configurations and values)
- Adds `PlaygroundSettings` compose UI renderer
- Reads / Saves settings to shared preferences, persisting them across executions.

# Testing
<!-- How was the code tested? Be as specific as possible. -->
- [ ] Added tests
- [ ] Modified tests
- [x] Manually verified

comment.body: I'll definitely iterate over this if I see value over time, the concept of snapshot is definitely valuable! especially as we add more settings in the future.

- Adds `PlaygroundSettings` compose UI renderer
- Reads / Saves settings to shared preferences, persisting them across executions.

# Testing

- [ ] Modified tests

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,136 @@
+package com.stripe.android.financialconnections.example.settings
+
+import android.app.Application
+import android.content.Context
+import android.util.Log
+import androidx.core.content.edit
+import com.stripe.android.financialconnections.example.BuildConfig
+import com.stripe.android.financialconnections.example.data.model.LinkAccountSessionBody
+import com.stripe.android.financialconnections.example.data.model.PaymentIntentBody
+import kotlinx.serialization.encodeToString
+import kotlinx.serialization.json.Json
+import kotlinx.serialization.json.JsonObject
+import kotlinx.serialization.json.JsonPrimitive
+
+internal data class PlaygroundSettings(
+    val settings: Map<PlaygroundSettingDefinition<*>, Any?>
+) {
+    fun <T> withValue(
comment.body: yeah, wanted to stay in line with state immutability. All these functions are just helpers to generate inmutable settings copies with updated values.

-)
